properties.name: Convention & Exhibition Center
properties.description: Posted by JeffreygenehkDesigned to look like a bird in flight, I also think it looks like a giant turtle or (less flatteringly) a huge cockroach. Most memorable moment at the Convention Center: when a group of Korean farmers, attempting to swim past a police barricade, threw themselves into the water to try to disrupt the WTO talks being held here in December 2005.

properties.name: Hong Kong International School
properties.description: Posted by JeffreygenehkÂ The Tai Tam Campus of one of the largest international schools in Hong Kong. Founded in 1966, recently it celebrated its 40th Anniversary. The members of this school community come from varied places, all over the world.

properties.name: IFC 2
properties.description: Posted by Jeffreygenehk#2 International Finance Center, known locally as "The Claw". This thing is huge. First building outside of the US to top 1000 feet. Make sure to zoom in close to see how BIG the shadow is - it\'s huge. When you can see all of it (that means on one of the few dozen days the city isn\'t shrouded in pollution or fog), it is amazing.

properties.name: ISF Academy
properties.description: Posted by JeffreygenehkCauseway Bay Campus, 2006-07. On the site of the St. Mary\'s Church College.

properties.name: ISF Academy Cyberport Campus
properties.description: Posted by JeffreygenehkThis purpose-built campus will open in the summer of 2007. Eventually holding up to 1800 students from K-12, ISF Academy offers bilingual instruction in both English and Putonghua. Currently undergoing accreditation from the International Baccalaureate: Middle Years Program, ISFA\'s unique approach to curriculum emphasizes holistic education and inquiry-based learning.

properties.name: Ma Wan Island
properties.description: Posted by Jeffreygenehk

properties.name: NEW Star Ferry Pier
properties.description: Posted by JeffreygenehkSee post on the OLD Star Ferry Pier for my thoughts on the changes to this iconic transportation service. I \'think\' I\'ve put this in the right place; the new star ferry pier is on reclaimed land, which should put it a bit in the water in this old satellite image. But I could be wrong.

properties.name: OLD Star Ferry Pier
properties.description: Posted by JeffreygenehkThis satellite image is clearly more than half a year old, as in the fall of 2006 the historic Star Ferry Pier was demolished to make way for, you guessed it, more shopping and office space. Because there\'s not enough of that in Central anyways. The Star Ferry USED to be a very cheap, convenient, and invigorating way to get from Central to the harborfront in Tsim Tsa Tsui; nowadays I find I still will use the ferry from TST to Central, but since I rarely find myself wandering near the new ferry pier I rarely use the ferry to get off of the island. What\'s next - the ding ding trams?

properties.name: TST Star Ferry Pier
properties.description: Posted by JeffreygenehkSee the comments on the OLD Star Ferry Pier, across the harbor in Central. Still the coolest way to get across the harbor, if no longer often convenient.
